title: Upper And Lower Heyford Canal Walk Route

images.caption: Bridge over River Cherwell

images.title: Neil Geering / Upper Heyford
images.caption: Manor Farmhouse, Upper Heyford, Oxfordshire, seen from the southwest. In the foreground is the Oxford Canal. Behind the house is the 15th-century west tower of St Mary's parish church. On the right is the end of the tithe barn, built about 1400.

images.title: Colin Bates / Allen's Lock, Upper Heyford
images.caption: Allen's Lock, Upper Heyford

images.title: Jon S / Rousham Eyecatcher
images.caption: Rousham Eyecatcher, located west of the canal on the way to Steeple Aston. Sham ruin created by William Kent (1684 - 1748), who also designed the gardens at Rousham House.

images.title: Basher Eyre / Road junction in the village centre at Steeple Aston
images.caption: Road junction in the village centre at Steeple Aston

description: This walk visits the pretty Oxfordshire villages of Upper And Lower Heyford. The villages sit in a pleasant waterside spot on the Oxford Canal and the River Cherwell. This circular walk starts at the train station at Lower Heyford before following a section of the canal north to Upper Heyford. Here you can enjoy views of the historic 15th century church and tithe barn. You'll then head west, crossing the river and canal before passing through the countryside to neighbouring Steeple Aston. You can extend the walk by heading a short distance south to visit Rousham Park. Here you'll find extensive gardens surrounding a 17th century country house.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head south and you will come to Kirtlington where you can explore the Kirtlington Quarry Nature Reserve. It's an interesting site where the fossils of several species of extinct mammal having been found. The historic Kirklington Park estate is also located in this area.

display_address: Kizzie's Bistro, Station Road, Lower Heyford, Steeple Aston, Cherwell, Oxfordshire, England, OX25 5PD, United Kingdom
